meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be rented.
meanings.sent1: The rentability of the apartment was high due to its convenient location.
meanings.sent2: Investors consider the rentability of a property before purchasing it.
meanings.sent3: The landlord joked about the rentability of the haunted house, saying ghosts pay rent too.
meanings.sent4: The rentability of the beachfront property was like a golden ticket for the owner.
meanings.sent5: The real estate agent emphasized the rentability of the commercial space to attract potential tenants.

meanings.definition: The capacity to generate income through renting.
meanings.sent1: The rentability of the vacation home was evident from the steady stream of rental bookings.
meanings.sent2: Property owners rely on the rentability of their assets to supplement their income.
meanings.sent3: The rentability of the storage unit business was booming, making the owner quite happy.
meanings.sent4: The rentability of the car rental service was like a well-oiled money-making machine.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the rentability of different properties is crucial for successful real estate investment.

meanings.definition: The profitability or financial viability of renting out a property.
meanings.sent1: The landlord assessed the rentability of the house to determine its potential income.
meanings.sent2: The rentability of the office space was a key factor in the decision to lease it out.
meanings.sent3: The rentability of the old warehouse surprised everyone when it turned out to be a cash cow.
meanings.sent4: The rentability of the apartment complex was the foundation of the property management company's success.
meanings.sent5: Maximizing the rentability of rental properties requires strategic pricing and marketing strategies.
